content.body: Hi everyone! I don't sure it is a right place for that but I don't know another place for. Today I found functions parseInt and parseFloat is not locale aware. I mean a code parseFloat('1.2') with dot as decimal separator (North America style) returns 1.2 but parseFloat('1,2') (Eastern Europe style) return 1. Also parseInt('1_000_000') return 1 but the string 1_000_000 is correct string for numbers since ES6 (ES7?)
Igor «InoY» Zviagintsev: yup, that is an accurate observation
content.formatted_body: Igor «InoY» Zviagintsev: yup, that is an accurate observation

content.body: it's not going to change though - many people rely on the behavior of `parseInt` being what it is
content.formatted_body: it's not going to change though - many people rely on the behavior of parseInt being what it is

content.body: and localized parsing is extremely fraught; see e.g. https://blog.sffc.xyz/post/190943794505/why-you-should-not-parse-localized-strings
see also https://github.com/tc39/ecma402/issues/1 and the several linked issues
